p: SARS-CoV-2 has spike proteins on its surface that bind to host cell proteins and subsequently aid viral entry. Given their small size, SARS-CoV-2 virions can be transmitted via air as part of aerosols [ 13]. However, due to the delicate nature of the lipid envelope of SARS-CoV-2 virions, the viral particle may become non-viable (i.e. non-infectious) once the envelope is damaged, even though their genetic fragments may still be detected.
